Class LevelTransitionManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelTransitionManager
public class LevelTransitionManager extends Object
Manages level transitions, including displaying messages and triggering callbacks. This class is responsible for stopping the game loop, showing a transition message, and triggering a level change callback after a delay.

    Creates a new LevelTransitionManager.

    Method
    Description
    void
    goToNextLevel(String levelName)
    Transitions to the next level by displaying a message, stopping the game loop, and executing the level change callback after a short delay.

    Sets the callback to be executed when a level change occurs.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelTransitionManager

      public LevelTransitionManager(javafx.scene.Group root, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, GameLoopManager gameLoopManager)
      Creates a new LevelTransitionManager.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node to which transition elements will be added
      screenWidth - the width of the screen
      screenHeight - the height of the screen
      gameLoopManager - the game loop manager for controlling game states

  • Method Details

    • setOnLevelChange

      public void setOnLevelChange(Consumer<String> callback)
      Sets the callback to be executed when a level change occurs.
      Parameters:
      callback - a Consumer that accepts the name of the next level

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Transitions to the next level by displaying a message, stopping the game loop, and executing the level change callback after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      levelName - the name of the next level
